Name: Warhammer (Fifth Edition): Champions of Chaos
Description:
Warhammer: Champions of Chaos is an expansion to the 5th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (specifically to the Warhammer: Realm of Chaos supplement).

This 48-page softcover book provides rules for twelve Chaos special characters.

Name: The Lion King: Simba's Pride – Hop-a-Croc Swamp Game
Description:
Join Kiara, Kovu, Timon, and Pumbaa on a challenging trip across moving logs and hungry crocodiles. 
Spin a dial to move 1 to 4 logs ahead or to move one of the movable logs.  Travel across the logs until you reach the end, except the movable logs may move you forward, backward or prevent you from moving ahead.

Name: Warhammer Armies (Fifth Edition): Dogs of War
Description:
Warhammer Armies: Dogs of War is an expansion to the 5th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Dogs of War faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer Armies (Fifth Edition): Vampire Counts
Description:
Warhammer Armies: Vampire Counts is an expansion to the 5th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Vampire Counts faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Dice Forge: Rebellion – The Pegasus Promo Card
Description:
Pegas is a promo card for use with Dice Forge: Rebellion.

The Pegasus card stack is played on a 3 sunshards spot on the game board.

No immediate effect.

Effect: When being ousted by another player, instead of placing a game piece on the original portal as in an usual oust effect, place it on a portal of an island of your choice, unoccupied by another player. Then, in addition to the usual divine blessings, you receive a minor blessing.

Note: If you have several Pegasus cards, receive as many minor blessings as Pegasus cards, but you only place your game piece once on a portal.

Name: Dice Forge: Rebellion – Hera Promo Card
Description:
Hera is a promo card for use with Dice Forge: Rebellion.

The Goddess Shadow card stands in for an Hydra card.

Name: Dice Forge: Rebellion – The Wheel of Fortune Promo Card
Description:
Wheel of Fortune is a promo card for use with Dice Forge: Rebellion.

The Wheel of Fortune card stack is played on a 4 sun shards spot on the game board.

Immediate effect: receive divine blessings once except in this one case: before rolling all the dice, pick and declare a roll outcome for each dice among all the likely outcomes on your dice (be sure to name a kind of dice face but not a resources outcome).
After applying your dice powers and putting them back in your Inventory:

• Win 8 VP if only one out of the two faces matches the declared outcomes.
• Win 20 VP if both faces match the declared outcomes.
• Don’t win additional VP if neither matches the declared outcomes

Name: Legion Atlantica
Description:
Legion Atlantica is a Strategic level two player board-wargame set in an alternative history second century CE in which the Roman Empire discovered the New World 1300 years before Columbus. Game turns represent months, hexes are roughly twenty miles across and Strength Points correspond to approximately 500 men. The player who controls their opponent’s capital first or the player with the largest number of city points at the end of the game is the winner.

The Roman Player controls the Invading Roman forces attempting to establish “New Rome” and extend their control over nearby Mesoamerican city states. The Tikal player controls the principle Maya kingdom trying to stop them. Both sides may attempt to conquer or win the allegiance of other Mesoamerican city states that start the game neutral, these include small independent city states as well as larger regional powers.

The game features Leaders who command armies but are also needed to conduct negotiations. Roman fleets and Mesoamerican canoe transports, low levels of transatlantic Roman reinforcements, cities that can be fortified, pillaged or destroyed, slave workers, supply and attrition, cavalry (Roman player only) and human sacrifice (Tikal player only).

By necessity almost all of the forces and characters represented are fictional, however the map is a realistic representation of the actual Mesoamerican terrain and the city states are those that there is evidence for at this time. The game represents the importance of food and river transport to the Maya and the key influence of superstitions and festivals. Celestial markers for the Moon, Venus, Mars and Jupiter are moved on a night sky track causing increasing unrest or even rebellion and changes of allegiance amongst the regional powers and city states, especially when 2 or more markers stack together.

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: ダイスガールズ Track 3 (Dice Girls Track 3)
ダイスガールズ Track 4 (Dice Girls Track  4)
Resident Evil 2: The Board Game – Malformations of G B-Files
Description: Add Birkin Stage One & Five Bosses to B-Files Expansion

Name: Resident Evil 2: The Board Game – Survival Horror Expansion
Description:
Total seven new Characters - Annette Birkin, Sherry Birkin, Ben Bertolucci, William Birkin, Brian Irons, Brad Vickers & Marvin Branagh
New weapons
New enemies - Giant Spiders, Ivy, Zombie Brad & Zombie Marvin
& new PVP Mode

Name: In a Wobble
Description:
A game of precision, skill and silliness! See how steady your drawing hand is with a giant wobbly pen! In A Wobble is a laugh-out-loud drawing and guessing game designed to be played in teams, and is a guaranteed way to get the whole family involved in the fun. Great for parties or family occasions, In A Wobble challenges players to remain steady and draw specific items while their team mates guess what it is though the catch is that all this is done with a giant vibrating pen! So put your artistic skills to the test and see how you handle the wobbly pen, then enjoy the attempts of your friends and family in this fun game anyone can play. The set includes 1 x giant vibrating pen, 1 x paper pad, 25 x cards (featuring 150 x items to draw), 1 x sand timer and full playing instructions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Grendha: Search For Lost Triumphs
Description:
Summary:
Grendha is an epic miniature game told through the thrilling story of a God gone mad and his two son’s quest to restore order. To do so they need to collect all of the pages of the powerful book that once belonged to their father. However, they have different views on what to do with the book. Should they destroy it or should they use the power that its pages unlock?

Players: 2-4 players, Competitive and co-op experience.
Type: Exploration, Strategy, War, Area Control, Set Collection, Resource Management, Negotiating/Trade

Game Play

In Grendha you take on the helm of one of four powerful heroes.
There is an ancient tome, and it is said that the hidden secrets of creation were locked inside its pages. There are also whispers that the same book turned a once benevolent god mad and caused him to turn on his own people. There is no way to know if the powerful tome can be wielded for good and restore order because the pages were torn from the binding and scattered through time and space. The book could not be destroyed, but it could be hidden. It is time for the book to be restored.

The objective is to search the map, collect those pages, and reform the lost book Grendha. The game can be played in a purely competitive mode at two players, or a cooperative team play mode at four players.

At all player counts, each player will choose a hero and take command of them and their armies. During the game, you will explore the mythical lands, command your warriors, collect items, discover clues, and gather resources. Your hero will need to slip through time, enter the celestial city, and discover the location of the lost pages. Quick! Your hero must restore the book before it is too late.

Name: Silly Safari
Description:
How exciting to be on safari, trying to spot all your favourite animals... but, hang on, one of them has wandered off!
Be the first to spot the missing animal!

The double-sided cards feature two levels of play. Choose the side with 7 possible animals for children or for learning the game, and choose the other side with 12 possible animals for a challenge!

In every card there is one missing animal compared to the key cards showing all possible animals. There is no taking turns, you can take the card if you are the first player to identify that missing animal!

After one of the piles runs out, the game ends. The player that has collected most cards wins the game.

Fun and frantic card game of matching and observation.

Name: Caveman
Description:
Do you speak caveman? No? Well, here's your chance to learn!

There are four pictures in the cards, with four possible background colour. Distribute the cards evenly between players, and if everybody is ready the game begins!

There is no taking turns, you have to find a match as quick as possible! It's a rapid race to get rid of your cards before your megalithic mates!

For example: if a player laid a card and called out "mamu" (that means mammoth), and in his card played the mamu was with blue background, all players would search through their cards looking for a mamu with blue surround. Once a player finds this combination, he can place the card on top of the pile and can call out the next word! Shout out one of the caveman words so that everyone knows what to look for next...

The first player to get rid of all his cards wins the game!

Name: Blanc-Manger Coco: La Geekerie
Description:
The irreverence Blanc-Manger Coco now attacks the world of the fans of the imagination and digital culture. You like the Marvel saga and the hugs with our friend Pedobear, the sequences of "0" and "1" make you think of poetry more than arithmetic: La Geekerie is for you!

Mix the cards or not with the other games in the range: you decide.

Contains 160 reply cards and 40 question cards.

Name: The Everrain: Undertow of Madness
Description:
Description from the Back of the Box;

This expansion adds two new types of uniquely able Special Crew, the Academics and Merchants, and two new enemy types, the Acolyte Speaker and Acolyte Bloodletter, to the game, as well as new and unique Sea Event, Expedition and Denizen cards. An undertow of madness threatens to disturb what passes for peace in this world on the brink of annihilation...

Name: Mech Showdown
Description:
18-card battle of mechs where the intial draft of equipment and weapons leaves two different mechs to use their tactical prowess to bring the other down.

Print-and-play card game based on the Battletech RPG. Tested, and created, by fans with attention to detail and balancing.

—description from the designer

Name: Inquisitor
Description:
Fifteen centuries have passed since Jesus descended from his cross, bathed Jerusalem in blood, and conquered Rome. The world has been ruled by inquisitors ever since.

Flame and Cross are symbols of The Holy Office, the institution whose sole purpose is to spread and defend the one and only true faith. But these symbols also contradict each other, for one represents Persian mages of fire, the other righteous Christians who fight them. The struggle goes on.

In this petty world, fear paralyzes the hearts of those who shy away from ruthless eradication of any signs of evil or corruption. This world is not even full of secrets, but it is surrounded by them, wallows in them, and cannot get away from them. Whenever an answer to a question is found, ten more questions appear immediately.

Inquisitor is a detective board game based on the series of best-selling short stories by Jacek Piekara that take you to the grim, fictional world of inquisitors.

Important note: Not any content of the game, neither images, nor the plot or background, is intended to offend anyone's religious feelings as they are merely props of a popular category known as "Religious Fiction".

Name: Colonialism: Upgrade Cards
Description:
This expansion adds a 6th available action to the game: Purchase Upgrade. This action allows players to spend collected resources to gain a permanent advantage for the duration of the game.

These are six additional cards which were added to the game for the 2018 reprint Kickstarter, and made available separately for owners of the first edition.

Name: Zoo Animals
Description:
Zoo Animals is a memory game for 1-4 players, ages 2-6.

Each card in the deck features a name and picture of a different animal; there is one pair of cards for each animal.  Players place the cards face down, and take turns turning over two cards, trying to make a match.  Players who make a match collect the pair of cards and try again.  The game ends when all cards have been matched, and the winner is the player with the most cards.

The game also features a solvable puzzle on the back of the game cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Alternatywy 4: Spisek
Description:
Spisek ("Conspiracy") is an add-on (expansion) for Alternatywy 4.

Contains:

     new deck of cards for the Host
     new deck of cards for the tenants
     new characters and their cards
     new cards of Abilities
     new deck of event cards 
     new activities on the board

Name: The Everrain: Art Book Promo Material
Description: 2 Ship Improvements, 2 Denizen, 3 Expedition and 1 Sea Event cards. It was given out together with the Art Book for The Everrain.

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): The Empire
Description:
Warhammer: The Empire is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect The Empire faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Orcs & Goblins
Description:
Warhammer: Orcs & Goblins is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Orcs & Goblins faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Power to the Meeple
Description:
Power to the Meeple is a complex, euro-styled strategy game where you attempt to become the mayor of Meepletown. The primaries have just ended and up to five candidates must fight to become the winner of the general election. Whether you choose to be a punk, a Democrat, a Republican and Independent or Green party is secondary to how well you organize your campaign and come up with a lean, effective strategy to win the most votes.

Power to the Meeple has three main gameplay phases. First the players participate in an augmented draft where they will be selecting resources. Most resources are just what they are, face value additions to a player's coffers. Alternatively, a player can pick lower valued resources that have abilities attached to them, which brings another balance to the player's strategy. Throughout the draft (which consists of as many rounds as players) each player is required to select one issue card which will stay with the player for the remainder of the game.

The second phase consists of each player, in turn order, deploying their five campaign tokens to the areas of the modular board they want to canvass (Urban, Estates, Eco-Buildings or Suburban areas).

During the third phase, tokens are revealed and the costs of the campaign are paid with the resources drafted earlier. Players who score in the top 3 positions on an area are usually awarded votes or other bonuses. Scores at individual locations are resolved by the key value comparisons printed on the areas, and the tie breakers are done according to who drafted the tie breakers such as Megaphone, Billboard, Scandal or Town Hall.

Once votes are counted, any money earned during that round are counted, players move up on their respective Urban, Suburban, Estate and Eco-Housing tracks, and lastly, discard all unused resources (besides money). All players also keep their issues.

Rounds 2 & 3 are similar to the first round, with the major difference being the advantages each player may have gained in the previous round.

After 3 rounds the players resolve any pending end of game awards or penalties for the last bit of votes and a winner is declared.

-description from designer

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Dwarfs
Description:
Warhammer: Dwarfs is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Dwarfs faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Vampire Counts
Description:
Warhammer: Vampire Counts is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Vampire Counts faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Dark Elves
Description:
Warhammer: Dark Elves is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Dark Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): High Elves
Description:
Warhammer: High Elves is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect High Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Skaven
Description:
Warhammer: Skaven is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Skaven faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Hordes of Chaos
Description:
Warhammer: Hordes of Chaos is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 112-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Hordes of Chaos faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Tomb Kings
Description:
Warhammer: Tomb Kings is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Tomb Kings faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Lizardmen
Description:
Warhammer: Lizardmen is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Lizardmen faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Beasts of Chaos
Description:
Warhammer: Beasts of Chaos is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Beasts of Chaos faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Bretonnia
Description:
Warhammer: Bretonnia is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Bretonnia faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Ogre Kingdoms
Description:
Warhammer: Ogre Kingdoms is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Ogre Kingdoms faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Wood Elves
Description:
Warhammer: Wood Elves is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Wood Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Dwarfs
Description:
Warhammer: Dwarfs is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Dwarfs faction and field it on the tabletop.

Released shortly before the coming of the 7th edition of Warhammer, this is a second army book for the Dwarfs faction in the 6th edition.

Name: ダイスガールズ Track 5 (Dice Girls Track 5)
Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Kislev
Description:
Warhammer: Kislev is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 34-page softcover booklet is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Kislev Allied Contingent mini-faction and field it on the tabletop.

The Warhammer Armies: Kislev booklet describes the Kislev Allied Contingent army for the 6th Edition of Warhammer by Games Workshop. This 36 page long supplement was released through White Dwarf magazine.
(user summary)

North from the land of the Empire lies a land of dark pine forests and snow-clad wilderness - the land of the Kislev, ruled by mighty Tzars and Tzarinas. The icy realm of Kislev breeds tough and hardy people, not only because of the harsh climate, but also due to the constant depredations by raiders from the Chaos Wastes.

Warhammer Armies: Kislev is a compendium of White Dwarf articles for using Kislev allied contingents within an Empire army. This booklet describes the troops of Kislev, its history, its gods and its heroes.

Inside you will find:
- Kislevite Allied Contingents. New rules for using Kislevites, plus full background detail including the lands and people of Kislev, their history and their wars.

- The Ice Queen and Tzar Barons. Rules for your army to include both the mighty Boris Ursus, the red Tzar, upon his fearsome mount Urskin, and Tzarina Katarin, the Ice Queen of Kislev, wielder of the Ice Magic.
(from the back cover of the booklet)

This booklet was provided with White Dwarf 288.

Name: Infinity: Third Offensive
Description:
A new book for Infinity. In it we can find all the details of the Third Offensive. Is Paradiso on the ropes? What’s the new threat to the Human Sphere? Enjoy the new rules, new Sectorial Armies and Fireteams.

This book covers the events that took place on the planet of Paradiso and makes clear that the alien threat is becoming very tangible and real. The Combined Army is not going to surrender, and Paradiso is only a bump on the road towards conquering the entire Human Sphere. In terms of where it lands within the Infinity narrative, it takes place directly after the events of Campaign Paradiso.

Paradiso lives up to its namesake: an astonishing paradise full of exquisite flora and fauna. In the past, this planet was inhabited by an alien race, though not much is known about the native sentient species. Their presence still lives on by the way of vast construction sites that can be found all over the planet, known as cosmolitos. It’s widely believed that these structures were the treasure that first caught the attention of the EI.

The high commanders of the various factions of the Human Sphere are trying to stop the EI from entering their systems by installing sophisticated blockades, but the Combined Army is managing to overcoming them with increasing frequency. In Third Offensive, you can read how they’re managing to smash through the different blockades and jeopardize the human hegemony on Paradiso.

The real objective of the EI will be also unveiled in this book.

What’s in the book?

As already stated, a lot of new background material that develops the narrative of the Infinity Universe, and it also provides several new locations to set the stage of our favorite wargame.

In addition to this, two new sectorials will be added to the roster of new releases - the unyielding Invincible Army of Yu-Jing and the Varuna Intervention Division for PanOceania. These will join the new armies most recently added with Operation Coldfront (Tartary Army Corps for Ariadna, and Operations Subsection for ALEPH)

Name: Vancouver Buses
Description:
Vancouver Buses is a roll and move game in which players take on the roles of bus drivers travelling around Vancouver. The first player to complete a circuit beginning and ending at the Kootenay Loop exchange wins.

The game was developed by the Vancouver Environment Education Project at the University of British Columbia to familiarise six to ten year old children with the Vancouver transit system.

—user summary

Name: Jazzy Pips
Description:
Jazzy Pips is a quick, cooperative dice game played in real-time for 3 to 6 players.

You’ve just formed a jazz band! It won’t be easy though. You know your instrument well, but you need to get to know the other musicians you’re playing with. This is the fun of joining a band! With practice, coordination, and the right tempo, you’ll be pulling off a memorable set at the local club in no time!

In Jazzy Pips, each player, or Musician,  must work together to overcome Song Cards by using your dice and making quick decisions at the same time. If you complete the Finale, you win! Be careful though, as the clock is ticking, and your dice are limited!

—description from the designer

Name: Speedy Towers
Description:
Speedy Towers is a light, fun, tower-stacking dexterity game for the piecepack.

Players create towers by stacking tiles and coins on top of each other in real time. Build your tiles and coins the fastest to win.

—description from the designer

Name: Reel Masters
Description:
Reel Masters is a 1-8 player tabletop fishing game. Move your boat, choose your lure and cast your line in hopes of hooking the monsters! Once you hook a fish, roll your dice against the fish to determine who is stronger. Pull hard enough and you can land the fish and earn a chance at cash for powerful upgrades.

Reel Masters has 5 species of game fish commonly found in lakes throughout the United States. This unique game truly captures elements of the real life experience.

Compete in multiple game modes with teams, solo or co-op. If your boat has the most total weight at the end of the game you win! The board changes every time you play and with multiple ways to play, Reel Masters is sure to bring fun to the table.

Good Luck and Tight Lines!

—description from the publisher

Name: Persist: The Game
Description:
Persist is a card game that helps women laugh at the ridiculous role assigned to them in the game of life. The double standards. Being told to smile by strangers. Mansplainers and manspreaders. Unsolicited questions about family planning. Not to mention all the ways women are doomed to fail at living up to culture’s standard of womanly virtue and grace. We know we sweat, we don’t glow.

Persist calls bullsh**. By asking women, their friends and allies to put all the cards out on the table—by being real, Persist invites women to laugh, learn from each other, connect meaningfully… and get up to fight another day.

How to Play Persist: Be the most persistent by earning three cards of the same life value (career, health, leisure, or relationships) to achieve a milestone. Collect three milestones to win.

Cards fall under six categories of gameplay: truth, would you rather, trivia, sharing, roadblocks, act it out, and the occasional wild card. Each category requires a different kind of action for the player to perform individually, with others, or even the whole group. Once played your cards may not be safe! Other players may steal your cards if they are going after the same values. This is where things get fun!

—description from the designer

Name: Goblin Derby
Description:
Goblin Derby is a racing game for 2-4 players. The first player to finish 3 laps around the dangerous and haphazard track is the winner.

Before the race starts players must first scavenge parts from the junkyard to build their, often wacky, vehicle. Then, after assembling their monstrosity, players roll dice to move their cart along the track.

Watch out for the other players, they will try anything to win from ramming you to throwing rocks to shooting rocket propelled goblins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Merchant Adventurer
Description:
Players take the role of businessmen during the 14th through 16th century in coastal Europe.  They can explore the seas and new lands, establish trade routes with foreign villages, gain influence in government through bribes, fight naval battles, trade shares of stock in maritime and colonial companies, engage in piracy, and invest in government and company bonds. They will also compete in score with 3 NPC factions: the mainland Europeans, the moneylenders, and the natives.

SHARES OF STOCK
The stock market system is pretty standard. Companies have 10 shares each and the player that owns the most shares controls the company. However, share price is not impacted by buys and sells, but only value of the company. One key difference in this to most stock market games is that not only can players own shares of stock in companies, but other companies and governments can own shares of stock as well. For example, if a government owns majority of shares in a company the player that controls that government then manages the company. A key difference compared to most other shareholding games is that the company can require shareholders to contribute further funds if the company is low on money. This was often the case in the early days of shareholding.

COMPANIES
Companies can build trading vessels that allow them to explore the sea and try to find overseas villages to trade with. They can also buy bonds released by governments or other companies. They can also build factories (old term for trading posts) in newly discovered lands as well as explore land. Companies do not start with any money, so they need to raise investments from players, governments, and other companies (or borrow from the moneylenders).

PORT CITIES (GOVERNMENTS)
Port cities are controlled by a magistrate. Players can become magistrates by bribing to gain prestige in the port city. Port cities are able to construct warships. Magistrates can also decide which companies can build vessels in their port city, as well as determine any tax on incoming trade brought by trading vessels. Magistrates can also ban the moneylenders to forgive all debt related to the magistrate, but this will make the moneylenders unavailable for the rest of the game to them.

EXPLORATION
The map is almost completely undiscovered, and as players move their watercraft into unknown territory 1 of 3 things can happen, 1: they discover empty water 2: they discover land, sometimes with a native village and sometimes with out 3: they run encounter a storm and sink. As all this happens map tiles are placed.

MONEYLENDERS
The moneylenders are the international banking community and are extremely important in the game. Players and governments start out with very limited funds, so the moneylenders are almost always needed. This mechanism is unique, and different than almost all other banking systems in games. The moneylenders themselves have limited funds, but practice fractional reserve banking. This means they lend out more money than they have, so it is possible that they will go under if other entities are unable or refuse to pay debts.

COMBAT
Combat in the game is simple and based on dice rolls. Players can go to war with each other and the natives. Cargo and other watercraft can also sometimes be seized.

BONDS
Governments and companies can issue bonds to raise funds. Companies, players, and governments can invest in these.

MAINLAND POWER
At the beginning of each turn the mainland power may attack a random port city. The mainland power represents mainland Europe. Tribute can be paid to avoid a possible attack. The mainland power may become powerful, but can also be reduced to nothing.

TRADE
The trading mechanism is simple, and is the main way to generate wealth. Company vessels transfer numbers that represent cargo back and forth between overseas villages and port cities.

WINNING THE GAME
The final score is based on the wealth of the player's family at the end of the game. The score of the mainland power, the moneylenders, the natives, and all ports and companies are also included. Players must attempt to get as much wealth in the hands of their family as possible, because at the end of the game the companies and ports they manage to contribute to their own score.

SOLO GAME
The solo game is the same as the normal game. It is able to function as so because of the NPC entities that have a final score, it is not meant for serious gaming. Its main purpose is to get a player accustomed to the peculiarities of the game.

Name: Top Trumps Quiz: Star Wars
Description:
Are you a Star Wars expert? Can you identify the difference between Episodes 4-6 & 1-3? Can you remember specific scenes from Episode 7: The Force Awakens? Travel to a galaxy far, far away and test your Star Wars knowledge to see if you are a force to be reckoned with. With 500 questions to answer, it's great for the whole family, whether you want a quick game on the go or to spend some time seeing how much you really know! With a Top Trumps twist at the end to test your memory, can you remember what you learned just moments ago?

Key Features


     Quizzical Star Wars fun with a Top Trumps Twist
     Entertaining educational card game loved for bringing your favourite Star Wars characters to life including questions on Yoda, Darth Vader and Luke Skywalker
     500 puzzling and captivating questions that will test your knowledge and memory on the Star Wars Saga
     Easy-to-carry plastic case means there are no limits on gameplay
     Prepare to outsmart your opponents, discover new and exciting facts and duel your way to becoming the Top Trump


—description from the publisher

Name: Sjónarspil
Description:
Sjónarspil is an Icelandic family and party game. Players get cards with adjectives and must choose the cards that best fit their opponents. Who in the group is the nerd and who is the helpful one? There is no correct answer, as players get more points the more players choose the same adjective. Great game for your group of friends, as the rules are simple, playing time is short and everyone acts at the same time - no wait for others.

—user summary

Name: The Popular Entertainment Box
Description:
Vintage family game suitable for people of all ages, playing individually or in teams.

A parlour party game, where players give answers or replies to puzzle type topics - as yet cannot give a date for it (suspect it may have been published around the 1950's, maybe even earlier?).
 Contains:

1 x Question / Puzzle ring-bound booklet - 48 pages of different categories/topics

1 x Solution / Answer ring-bound booklet - 48 pages

Name: Hispánica: La Conquista de la Historia de España
Description:
In Hispánica, The Conquest of the History of Spain, there are battles, conquests, betrayals, pacts, knowledge tests and many more emotions. Share your passion for history, have fun and learn with more than 220 characters and historical facts that, from prehistory to the Constitution of 1978, will be parading during the game.
Is a game of strategy and knowledge that brings together characters and historical facts and offers players the possibility of conquering Spain.

With 128 characters, 64 relevant events and more than a thousand historical references, Hispanica intends to give a turn of the screw to historical games to bring them closer to those interested in History and the gamers. It is a game designed to learn from scratch or reaffirm previous knowledge of History.

—description from the designer

Name: Kraken Ataken!
Description:
Players control krakens trying to reclaim stolen treasure from the ships of vile pirates. Each round, players assign krakens to ships, strengthen them with more tentacles (whose power is secret from the other players) or play cunning kraken tricks on their opponents. Eventually the krakens fight each other to decide who will face a pirate crew and attempt to win back the stolen treasure! Whoever gains the most treasure wins the game and is crowned The Kraking for good!

—description from the publisher

Name: Pour Taste: The spin it, mix 'em, drink up game!
Description:
In the hilarious Pour Taste game, players choose 6 ingredients (ingredients not included) and fill each cup with one of them. Then, each player takes a turn spinning the spinner. The spin will tell the player which ingredients to mix up -- or whether to choose another player to drink, steal chips, or go bankrupt. Will the drink taste ok or totally gross? It's up to the player to decide whether or not they will drink up. Every time a player drinks from a cup, they earn a chip. If they decide not to drink the concoction, they lose a chip. The first player to get 4 chips wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Transformers Prime
Description:
This is a DotA(Defense of the Ancients)/LoL(League of Legends) like boardgame which be sold only in China. In the game, players are divided into two teams to compete with each other. They can move on the hexagonal grids, play cards and use their Transformer heroes' unique powers to win an advantage over their opponents. And complete the mission to win the game.

—user summary

Name: Rolling Orchards
Description:
Welcome to Rolling Orchards, a 2-player game of growing apples and pumpkins at your personal orchard. Turn them to pies and cider to accumulate more points than your opponent. Make the most out of your resources as the season could be over before you know it.

Rolling Orchards utilizes a dice placement mechanic where players select dice from a pool and place them in turn on action spaces. The number and color of the die determine the benefit gained from that space.

Third Place finisher in the Roll and Write Global Jam 2018!

—description from the designer

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Nemesis 9 Tyrantis: Tyranid Commander Set
Description:
The bioform codified by the Inquisition as Nemesis 9 Tyrantis is a true horror. It prizes terror so highly it likes to leave one prey-creature from each group of victims alive so they might spread their fear to the common herd of Vigilus like a virus. Nemesis 9 Tyrantis has on more than one occasion been mistaken for the leader of the planet’s Genestealer Cult infestation – however, so long as the Broodlord gets to feed on the minds and bodies of the populace, it cares little for the chatterings of ambulatory biomass.

Add a Commander – a powerful hero character with unique abilities and rules – to your Tyranid kill team with this set. It contains a multipart plastic Broodlord miniature, a set of cards packed with exclusive rules and a sheet of tokens for use in-game:

- A Broodlord: this multipart plastic kit is used to represent Nemesis 9 Tyrantis – or the Commander of any Tyranid kill team you wish – standing atop a chitinous structure, poised ready to strike with his truly horrifying monstrous rending claws, his maw open and showing off rows of sharp fangs
- A datacard for Nemesis 9 Tyrantis, featuring its characteristics, weapons, abilities and specialisms, along with a card featuring his background
- A card featuring Nemesis 9 Tyrantis’ skill tree – Broodlord specialisms which can only be used by that character
- 3 Hive Mind Discipline psychic power cards
- 3 Tyranid Commander Tactics Cards, including 2 Tactics exclusive to this set
- A sheet of tokens for use in games of Kill Team – this includes 1 Move/Charge token, 1 Fall Back/Advance token, 1 Ready/Shoot token, 6 Tactic/psychic power tokens, 3 wound tokens, and 3 objective tokens.

-description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Crasker Matterzhek: Genestealer Cults Commander Set
Description:
Crasker Matterzhek of the Elevated Siblings bears the standard of his kindred, a sacred duty given to him by Primus Desh. The icon of Grandsire Wurm must be seen from the highest vantage point, to boost the rebellion’s morale in this vital hour – with the cult’s most experienced kill team alongside him, Crasker feels sure he will make it to the very tip of the sprawl’s tallest spire. Perhaps he will raise it so high that the Star Children will see him, and grant him the desire he so fervently desires...

Add a Commander – a powerful hero character with unique abilities and rules – to your Genestealer Cults kill team with this set. It contains a multipart plastic Acolyte Iconward miniature, a set of cards packed with exclusive rules and a sheet of tokens for use in-game:

- An Acolyte Iconward: this multipart plastic kit is used to represent Crasker Matterzhek – or the Commander of any Genestealer Cults kill team you wish – armed with an autopistol, blasting charges and rending claws the Iconward clutches his cult’s sacred banner hoisting it aloft to inspire his broodkin to surge forward in a wave of indiscriminate violence
- A datacard for Crasker Matterzhek, featuring his characteristics, weapons, abilities and specialisms, along with a card featuring his background
- A card featuring Crasker Matterzhek’s skill tree – Acolyte Iconward specialisms which can only be used by that character
- 4 Broodmind discipline psychic power cards
- 5 Genestealer Cults Commander Tactics Cards, including 2 Tactics exclusive to this set
- A sheet of tokens for use in games of Kill Team – this includes 1 Move/Charge token, 1 Fall Back/Advance token, 1 Ready/Shoot token, 6 Tactic/psychic power tokens, 3 wound tokens, and 3 objective tokens.

-description from the publisher

Name: Of Soldiers & Strongholds
Description:
A 2 player chess derivative type game where players roll dice and set up Fortifications to gain control of and dominate the battlefield. Players will be able to obtain Supplies to aid their endeavors as they both vie for the top.

Each player controls one of four Armies which each consist of 7 different pieces (each Army differs in type) that can be used for tactical thinking, critical math skills for younger children, and a simple-but-fun and straightforward gameplay.

Suitable for ages as low as 8+, and the game comes with:

     14 polyhedral dice
     10 colored six-sided dice
     2 white six-sided dice
     9 Supply sticks
     sheet of felt
     rule book
     piece of merchandise
     game map


Players take turns moving their Armies across the board and attacking each other and each other's Fortifications as they vie for last man standing status. Player polyhedral dice start on their highest numbers and are reduced through battle until they are wiped from the board. Fortifications include: Outposts, Bases, and Forts, each with differing ranges and providing different advantages/disadvantages. Supplies include: Lapis Slabs, Hemp Stacks, Blood Vials, Gold Ingots, and Lavender Sprigs.

Can be played on the provided game map, or on any chess/draught board. Complex enough for adults to lose themselves playing for hours while still simple enough to appeal to children. Makes a perfect gift for the board gamer friend/significant other in your life!

—description from the publisher

Name: Pacific Throat Punch
Description:
Pacific Throat Punch is a double-blind wargame simulating the conflict between the Empire of Japan and the Allied Powers from Pearl Harbor to mid-1944. Both players move units on their own maps. When units enter unoccupied or enemy-controlled areas, they are revealed and placed on a combat tile. While sea and air combat are critical, the only way to drive an opponent from a territory is through the use of ground forces.

Please note that the artwork is unfinished and is for personal use only as it contains some material borrowed from the internet.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): Orcs & Goblins
Description:
Warhammer: Orcs & Goblins is an expansion to the 7th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Orcs & Goblins faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): The Empire
Description:
Warhammer: The Empire is an expansion to the 7th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect The Empire faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): High Elves
Description:
Warhammer: High Elves is an expansion to the 7th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 104-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect High Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): Daemons of Chaos
Description:

This 96-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Daemons of Chaos faction and field it on the tabletop.

Description:

This 96-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Vampire Counts faction and field it on the tabletop.

This 104-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Dark Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): Warriors of Chaos
Description:

This 128-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Warriors of Chaos faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): Lizardmen
Description:
Warhammer: Lizardmen is an expansion to the 7th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 104-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Lizardmen faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): Skaven
Description:
Warhammer: Skaven is an expansion to the 7th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 112-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Skaven faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): Beastmen
Description:
Warhammer: Beastmen is an expansion to the 7th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Beastmen faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Fantastiq
Description:
Unleash your inner artist with Fantastiq!

Each round you receive a commission, a title describing the thing you must sculpt. All players make their creations at the same time using the included modeling clay. When everyone is done, it's time for the exhibition! You have to associate the correct title to each sculpture, and you earn points for each correct guess. You also gain points depending on how much your own sculpture has been guessed by the other players!

Name: Lion's Heart, Saracen's Steel: Battle of Arsuf, September 7, 1191
Description:
Lion’s Heart, Saracen’s Steel: The Battle of Arsuf, September 7, 1191. This is the latest game in  the Battles of the Middle Ages Series, an easy to learn wargame system that tries to recreate most of the principal battles fought from Roman Times to the dawning of Renaissance. These games are designed to be fast and furious, easy to learn and to play, but still true to the historical events portrayed. Lion's Heart, Saracen's Steel portrays the decisive battle of Arsuf. Richard the Lionhearted led the Crusader Army that was confronted by the legendary Ayyubid leader, Saladin. Although the Crusaders emerged victorious in this hard fought battle, the Third Crusade was ultimately a failure. Can you do as well or better?

—user summary
Families: Series: Battles of the Middle Ages (High Flying Dice)

Name: Trivial Pursuit: AMC – The Walking Dead
Description:
This edition of Trivial Pursuit features 600 questions from all 7 seasons of of AMC’s The Walking Dead, including characters, locations, events and episodes.

Players score points if they answer a question correctly. A colored die tells you which question to ask.

Name: Race for the Chinese Zodiac: Cat
Description:
The Cat is a promotion expansion item for Race for the Chinese Zodiac base game. It comprises of the Cat animal sign card and the Cat animal sign token.

The Cat is to be added to the 12 animal signs of the base game and can be chosen for play on any of the three player counts.

The Cat's special ability was specially designed to reflect the Cat's role in the ancient folk story of the Great Race and is different from those of the 12 animal signs of the base game.

-description from designer

Name: 死盤遊戯 (Boardgame of Death)
Description:
Challenge the tower where death waits with a fist!

You are a novice in martial arts.
By challenging a number of fighters over the tower of death, your fighting skills will be sharpened. The ultimate goal is to defeat the boss awaiting at the summit, and earn the reputation as the strongest fighter.

However, you are still weak when you first visit the tower.
In order to challenge the boss, you have to gain experience while fighting the rival fighters encountered in the middle of the tower.

Boardgame of Death is a card game with deck building as the major mechanism. Through the use of "Combo" which connects different martial arts skills, damage will be given to rival fighters. The game system allows players to acquire martial arts skills by knocking down enemies.

Let's train your fighter to become the strongest one through repeating scenes of victory and defeat.

—user summary

Name: Not Men But Devils: The Battle of Camerone
Description:
Refight the Battle of Camerone, a ten hour fight in the heat and dust near Vera Cruz on April 30th 1863 between the French Foreign Legion and the Mexican army. Regarded as a defining moment in the Foreign Legion's history, after the battle and learning just how few French troops there were, the Mexican commander exclaimed, "These Are Not Men, They Are Devils!"

—description from the publisher

Name: 17 Steps
Description: 17-Steps is an awareness-raising game. It’s to raise an awareness of the SDGs, there are 17 of them. You can’t talk about achieving the global goals if you don’t first create awareness about it. People need to know what it is. The game originated from the fact that we have 17 SDGs, and the game is supposed to lead you to a paradise. But before you get to that paradise, you have to take 17 steps based on your knowledge of the SDGs.

Name: Atnor
Description: Atnor (means ‘five’ in Eggon Language) is a game of five. Players are imersed in a tactical environment to have a set of five. Perfect for lovers of logic and strategy.

Name: Gbosi
Description: Gbosi means ‘Symbol of Authority’. It is a game that tells the true story of the fight for a throne between two men. Who gets the throne? Play to find out.

Name: Homia
Description:
Build your Nigerian home regardless of tribe or religion and be the first to do that if you want to win. The story behind Homia is that Nigeria is a multi-cultural, multi-ethnic and multi-religious country and the player must create a family regardless of the culture or religion. It’s designed to be easy to play. You choose a family and build the family.

Homia is a Memory-style game, where you look at a face down card and try to remember what kind it is. Until you find a homestead tile (also called a "family pad"), you will only memorize where the various tiles are, and put them back face down on the table. Once you finally discover a family pad, you take it into your area. The family pad has various symbols that represent different parts of a household, such as fathers, mothers, sisters, brothers, and pets. The color of the symbol tells you what kind of other cards you will need to complete your family pad. If your family pad has a green symbol, for example, you need to collect one "father" (green background) card to add to your family pad. If there are three yellow symbols on the family pad card, it means he has three daughters, so you'll need to find three of the "daughter" (yellow background) cards to complete your family. If you have a good memory of the cards you looked at before finding your family pad, it will be much easier to find the members of the household required to complete your family pad. Whoever completes their family pad first is the winner!

Name: Luku Luku Abstract
Description:
LUKU-LUKU is an education game with three editions – Noun, Abstract and Map. It’s a fast game and based on the name, it is about how fast your eyes can move. This game tends to make people aware of their surroundings. Lukuluku Map is more of a geographical game while Abstract teaches stars, numbers
and regular shapes in a fun way depending on what the player wants to learn.

Name: Luku Luku Map
Description:
LUKU-LUKU is an education game with three editions – Noun, Abstract and Map. It’s a fast game and based on the name, it is about how fast your eyes can move. This game tends to make people aware of their surroundings. Lukuluku Map is more of a geographical game while Abstract teaches stars, numbers
and regular shapes in a fun way depending on what the player wants to learn.

Name: Mgbako
Description: Mgbako (means ‘to calculate’ in Igbo language) is a speed arithetic Boardgame made in Nigeria. Players compete to earn points by beating their opponent in simple arithmetic. It’s not as simple as it sounds. Try winning when the stakes are up and tensions are high.

Name: Nwanyi Iga
Description:
It’s a folklore of the Igbo culture meaning Proud Woman. Players compete as
soothsayers to save her from her untimely demise.

Name: Oyyaa
Description: Oya is a game designed based on the life of a Lagosian (someone who lives in Lagos Nigeria). It explores the Olokpa (police), the JJCs, The Area Boys and hustlers alike. It’s a fast-paced game.

Name: Safe Journi
Description: Safe Journi chronicles the journey of a traveller on a Nigerian road. Your fellow players use the obstacles encountered in a Nigerian road to prevent you from reaching your destination. Your task is to manoeuvre the obstacles and get to your destination unharmed.

Name: The Battle of Adrica
Description:
The Berzuline conference did not go as planned. Tempers are high, fresh wounds come to mind. The treasure lay awaiting exploitation.

It was clear a battle would occur.

Name: Ukubuwa
Description:
UKUBUWA is a misspelt Swahili word for ‘Greatness’, and it takes you through a journey of young people as you earn and lose wealth. , Ukubuwa is a game that takes you through the four stages of life in your perspective.
It starts with the Learning stage (things that affect you in this stage), then takes you to the Idea stage (Talent Development), the Philanthropy level. The interesting thing is that it brings choice and chance to play – chance because you have to roll dice and play, choice because you have to make decisions. It was designed basically for storytelling. While playing, you gain certain things like how to negotiate, how to spend money. It’s the mechanism. Overall, it’s a game of choice and chance.

Name: Legions of Battle
Description:
Legions of Battle are a set of Fantasy wargame rules designed to allow you to fight epic battles between a vast array of creatures and races.

The rules themselves can be tailored to suit any fantasy setting and the game system is designed to allow you to create and field any troops that you like, limited only by your imagination and figures available. A comprehensive points system allows the design of troops as you think they should be represented.

Name: Warhammer (Eighth Edition): Orcs & Goblins
Description:
Warhammer: Orcs & Goblins is an expansion to the 8th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 112-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Orcs & Goblins faction and field it on the tabletop.

Description:
Warhammer: Tomb Kings is an expansion to the 8th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Tomb Kings faction and field it on the tabletop.
